永動機是應用磁場的相吸相斥達到了旋轉的效果，而我的循環重力式發電機，是以位能換取動能，構造上與理論上皆不同，所以不該歸類成永動機。

 
水力發電機是依靠水往低處流的動能轉動發電轉子產生感應電動勢,既一般所說的電力，過程中不需要消耗熱能，反而會因機組轉動磨擦產生熱，而且還需要散熱，所以才會說水力發電是乾淨的能源。

 火力與核能發電則是恰恰相反，是應用熱能把水加熱成蒸氣，再由蒸氣推動發電機組，產生電力，所以才需要熱能，在加熱過程中
所產生的懸浮粒子或核廢料卻又讓環境產生負擔，故而被稱之為不乾淨的能源。

 
我的發電機組是由一個傳動馬達同時帶動兩條輸送帶，而輸送帶上有為數眾多的發電轉子，當傳動馬達轉不到十圈(消耗電力極小），就有兩個發電轉子同時在線圈軌道中由上而下轉動產生電力，而且軌道線圈可以極大化的延伸，而使產生的電力達到最佳效益，產生的電力再反饋給傳動馬達，多餘的電力既可以輸出，成為一種乾淨的能源。

是文字敘述，還是圖案，看不懂？建議您可以先請教物理科的教師，或是從事發電機工程人員，先了解一下傳統發電機原理，再深入了解。 
在此請您先明嘹，電風扇的基本原理就是一台發電機。
將電風扇插上電源，風扇轉動，就是將電能轉化成機械能，消耗電能，使馬達轉動產生風力；反之，電風扇不插上電能，藉由風力轉動電風扇，在插頭的一端即能產生電能，也就是說，是由風力提供了機械能而使電風扇轉動產生了電能，即是大型風力發電機的基本原理。簡捷來說，就是提供電能使風扇產生風，或者是由風力轉動扇葉，使其產生電能。
我的設計原理就是把線圈由圓形改變成上下兩層的長條斜坡(以下稱之為一組)，藉由多個的磁鐵由上而下的滾動產生電能，基本上提供了發電機所需要的機械能，當磁鐵滾動到低處，再由輸送帶傳送至高處，如此周而復始，由高至低的滾動。

 本設計，是由對稱的兩組斜坡，與兩條對稱的輸出帶，一個轉動輸送帶的馬達，以及為數眾多的磁鐵組合而成。
運轉之初，需額外的提供外部電能趨使馬達將磁鐵運送至高處再讓磁鐵滾動在長條斜坡產生電能至低處，待其發電後輸送帶馬達所需電能，由本身發電供應就可移除外部電能了，(類似汽車由電瓶提供外部電能，供應啟動馬逹啟動汽車內燃機，“俗稱引擎“後，待其運動後由引擎接手後續汽車所需要的動力來源一樣，汽車電瓶就不用再供應汽車的動力了）。
由一台馬達趨動兩條對應的輸送帶的方式，(一台馬達所需電能很少，可由發電機本身產出的電能供應)，輸送帶傳送至高處滾動至低處，再由另一條輸送帶到高處，滾動在另一組的線圈到低處，(也就是輸送帶“高＂.發電線圈＂低."）；高滾動至低.＂過程產生電能<多>“，低傳送至高“過程消耗電能<少>"，產生的多電能扣除消耗的少電能，就有多餘的電能輸出了。
動作原理：高至低,低到高；高至低，低到高，如此周而復始產出電能，後面幾項關於電壓及頻率的問題，在此先不贅述，希望此解讀，有幫您明瞭到基本的構造原理。

「荷蘭來的臺灣人」畢耀遠神父逝世
R. I. P. to Father Pierrot, “The Taiwanese from the Netherlands”

 「荷蘭來的臺灣人」、96歲的神父畢耀遠（Pierrot Antoine Henri Marie），是雲林縣天主教若瑟醫院創辦人之一，今天凌晨4點逝世。

 
畢耀遠神父1954年從故鄉芬克芬（Vinkeveen）來到臺灣嘉義後，一輩子貢獻於臺灣，最常掛在嘴邊的一句話就是「臺灣是我的故鄉」。他秉持「全犧牲、真愛人、常喜樂」的精神，數十年來成立許多慈善基金會，協助貧困、肢體障礙病患與早產兒，受益者無數。他喜歡帶著相機四處拍照，更留下許多臺灣發展過程珍貴的紀錄，去年春天還舉辦引起迴響的攝影作品個展。

 畢神父生前在嘉義市省道台一線旁，監工興建「南台灣最美麗教堂」稱譽的市天主教聖奧德教堂，被嘉義市政府列為「歷史建物」文化資產，
有斜頂式建築及馬賽克宗教藝術創作。

 
畢耀遠神父先後獲得2011年內政部頒發「傑出永久居留外僑終生奉獻獎」、2015年總統頒贈「紫色大綬景星勳章」、2017年吳尊賢文教基金會「慈善服務類愛心獎」等多個國家與社會團體的獎項。去年畢神父96歲慶生會上，更獲得雲林縣長李進勇頒贈榮譽縣民證書，感謝他募款興建醫院學校，奉獻台灣土地超過一甲。

the Catholic Joseph Hospital in Yunlin County, passed away at 4 am today. He was
96.

 After arriving in Chiayi, Taiwan from his hometown Vinkeveen in 1954, Father
Pierrot has dedicated the rest of his life to Taiwan. He called Taiwan his own
“hometown.” Based on his motto of “Sacrifice Completely, Love Truly, and Rejoice
Evermore,” he has established many charitable foundations for the past decades
to help the poor, the physically challenged, and premature infants, and
countless people have been benefited. He liked to take pictures with his camera,
leaving behind many precious records of Taiwan's development. Last spring, he
also held a solo photo exhibition.

 Father Pierrot father also helped build the “most beautiful church in southern
Taiwan,” the St. Ode Cathedral in Chiayi City next to the provincial highway.
With its sloping roof and religious arts in mosaic, it has been listed as a
“historical building” as a cultural heritage site by the Chiayi City Government.

 Father Pierrot was awarded the "Award of Outstanding Achievements for Permanent
Residents" by the Ministry of the Interior in 2011, the "Order of Brilliant Star
with Violet Grand Cordon" by the President in 2015, the "T.H. Wu Service and
Love Award" by the T.H. Wu Foundation in 2017 and numerous awards by the state
and other social groups. Last year, the Mayor of Yunlin County Mr. Lee Jin-Yong
awarded the honorary citizenship certificate to Father Pierrot to thank him for
raising funds to build a hospital school and donated more than one hectare of
land to Taiwan.

[News Sharing] The Netherlands Launches White Paper on Circular Construction

 荷蘭駐台辦事處與台灣營建研究院今（8日）共同發表「循環營建白皮書」，從花博荷蘭館經驗證明循環營建在台灣確實可行。荷蘭駐台代表紀維德（Guy
Wittich）說，推動循環營建需要所有人的合作努力，例如消費者選擇時增加意識，科學家尋找新技術，業者也需要重新打造商業模式，政府則需要限制廢棄物、獎勵重覆使用、實行循環採購。

 
紀維德也建議台灣，由政府率先透過公共建設與採購，開啟循環營建發展，包括採用模組化建材、認證舊建材合法重覆使用，規劃推行與世界接軌的建材記錄平台，除了可顯示循環比例、互相激勵，更方便舊建材交易，帶動新的商業模式、鼓勵跨界合作。

 The Netherlands Office in Taiwan launched a white paper on circular
construction today, citing their experience at the Taichung Flora Exposition to
state that circular construction is possible in Taiwan. Guy Wittich, the
Representative of the Netherlands Office in Taiwan, said that the implementation
of circular economy requires everyone to work together, as consumers should
raise their awareness, scientists should look for new technologies,
manufacturers should reinvent business models, and government should restrict
waste production, incent material use, and practice circular procurement.

 Wittich suggested that the Taiwan government start with circular procurement to
initiate the development of circular construction, including using modular
building materials and certifying second-hand building materials for legal
reuse. He also suggested adopting international platforms that document
materials used in buildings to announce and encourage circularity in the world
and facilitate the trading of used building materials.

不只要救白海豚！荷蘭電場還用風機養蚵

 
荷蘭以大數據評估、監控離岸風電的生態衝擊，已經累積3年的經驗；本處邀請荷蘭政府的資深風場生態顧問，來臺參加亞太國際風力發電展，並且舉辦研討會、講座與產、官、學界分享經驗，同時也請來「荷蘭能源港」專家，分享如何以離岸風電計畫，扶持周邊地方產業鏈。

 荷蘭公共工程與水資源管理局（Rijkswaterstaat）的資深風場生態顧問德庸（Maarten de
Jong）表示荷蘭政府2016年起執行「離岸風場生態計畫」（WOZEP），綜合開發商前期10年按法規提供的監控數據，繼續執行大數據監控，了解施工前環評結果與實際生態影響的差距，提出改善方法，進而影響針對2030年後的生態保護政策。

 
德庸表示，「我們經過評估後，認為最重要的是鎖定鼠海豚、鳥類和蝙蝠三個物種，除了測量施工海底噪音、海流變化，也監控海豚的體重和進食量、候鳥動線與衝撞，並且以無線電訊號標記蝙蝠，紀錄飛行路線，實際了解風場長時間對生物的影響，並且因應改變未來的規範數據」。

 
同時，當局也要求風電業者的設施能夠融入生態環境，例如在示範場域用創新材料取代傳統水泥，建立可以養蚵的淘刷防護，研究是否能降低生物棲地的改變。主持該計畫的Deltares公司，目前也已經協助臺灣風場在荷蘭的實驗室進行先驗計畫，了解可行的措施。

 根據研究，營建業消耗全球40%的能源和原物料，而有25%到40%的廢棄物，也來自營建業；荷蘭政府希望在2050年達成零廢棄物的循環經濟，重點之一就是營建產業。

 
我們結合40個臺荷單位，在去年的臺中花博建造全臺第一、也是全球第一座接受英國標準協會（BSI）查證的循環建築；今年4月花博落幕，更是世上第一座被拆除的循環建築，建材將在月眉的循環設計園區重新被使用，證明在臺推行循環營建的時機已經成熟。

我們學到最重要的功課，就是所有關係各方都要合作努力，才能建立平台，制定清楚的目標和行動方針，推動循環營建。從購屋人、建商、建築師、學者、科學家，政策制定者、供應商到製造商，都應該立即加入、邁向循環。

 天文學家透過「事件視界望遠鏡」（EHT）觀測計畫，史上首次成功捕捉星系 M87 （Messier
87）中心超大質量的黑洞，距離太陽系約5千5百萬光年。全球有8個觀測站、13個研究單位加入EHT計畫，包括中央研究院，是首次觀測成像的四個團隊之一；而8座望遠鏡中，有3座是由中研院支援運轉。

 EHT科學委員會主席Heino
Falcke，是荷蘭奈梅亨Radboud大學的教授。來自奈梅亨、阿姆斯特丹大學、萊頓大學的天文學家，以及葛洛寧恩大學NOVA技術的亞毫米波團隊，都參與計畫。

black hole and its shadow. They used the Event Horizon Telescope (EHT), a
worldwide network of eight radio telescopes, comprising 13 research units from
around the world, including Taiwan's Academia Sinica, to capture the image in
the heart of the massive distant galaxy Messier 87, some 55 million light-years
from Earth. The project consists of eight radio observatories, and Academia
Sinica members helped install three of them. Academia Sinica was one of the
first four teams that successfully captured the image.

 Heino Falcke, Professor of Astroparticle Physics and Radio Astronomy at Radboud
University, the Netherlands, is the chair of the EHT Science Council.
Astronomers from Nijmegen, the University of Amsterdam, and Leiden University
are involved in the project, as well as the NOVA-technical submm-group of the
University of Groningen.

text:
闔眼入眠，你夢中的媽祖，長什麼樣子呢？

 媽祖第一次正式登上國際舞台，大概是荷蘭醫師達波（Olfert Dapper）編著、范慕爾斯（Jacob van
Meurs）在阿姆斯特丹於1670年出版的《使團第二次及第三次出訪大清（中國）記》（Tweede en derde gesandschap na het
keyserryck van Taysing of China）。

 書中紀錄「臺灣」（Eiland Tayowan，直譯為大員島）各地的風俗民情，其中也包括「第三十九個神或女神」（de negen en dertigste
God of
Goddin）的故事，「名叫娘媽（Nioma），或是媽祖（Matzou）」，並且附上東西合璧的媽祖廟插圖，用歐洲社會的宗教認知與異國想像，描繪臺灣旅途的田野紀錄和文化印象，宛如17世紀歐洲人的亞洲夢境。

 達波從未到過亞洲，卻靠著旅人的遊記和繪聲繪影的文字和圖像，讓歐洲人看得如癡如醉。如果想要知道更多荷蘭人在 17 世紀開啟的東西交流，千萬別錯過 國立故宮博物院
National Palace Museum與荷蘭國家博物館合作的展覽別冊《亞洲探險記-十七世紀東西交流傳奇》。

 Close your eyes and picture the sea goddess of Matsu in your dream. What does
she look like?

 The debut of Matsu on the international stage was probably the “Second and
Third Mission to the Empire of Taiching or China” (Tweede en derde gesandschap
na het keyserryck van Taysing of China) written by Dutch doctor Olfert Dapper
and published by Jacob van Meurs in Amsterdam in 1670.

 The book documented the custom and cultures of Taiwan (understood as “Eiland
Tayowan,” or the Island of Tayowan), including the story of the “thirty-ninth
god, or goddess” (de negen en dertigste God of Goddin) named “Nioma” or
“Matzou.” A picture of a temple of Matsu combining Western and Eastern zests is
provided. The understanding of religion and the imagination of foreign countries
of the European society were used to depict the field documentation and cultural
impression on the trip to Taiwan. It looks like an Asian dream of an European in
the 17th Century. 

 Dapper never visited Asia, but based on travelogues by others, he enchanted
Europeans with his colorful words and fanciful images. If you want to learn more
about the exchanges between the East and the West fostered by the Dutch in the
17th Century, don’t miss the exhibition catalogue of “Expedition To Asia-The
Prominent Exchanges Between East & West in The 17th Century” published by the
National Palace Museum in cooperation with Rijksmuseum.

Office Launches White Paper with Scholars of Construction

 
紀維德指出，荷蘭館締造世界第一、實現「台版循環建築」，一年多的過程卻也充滿挑戰，因此與台灣營建研究院合作，記錄分析荷蘭館的經驗，集結世界案例成實用的參考手冊。他建議政府率先透過公共建設與採購，開啟循環營建在台發展，包括採用模組化建材、認證舊建材合法重覆使用，也推行使用與世界接軌的平臺記錄建材，除了可顯示循環比例、互相激勵，更方便舊建材交易。

 Guy Wittich pointed out that the Holland Pavilion at the Taichung Flora Expo
has made world record and materialized the Taiwanese version of circular
construction, but the year-long project has also seen many challenges. The
Netherlands’ Office therefore has partnered with the Taiwan Construction
Research Institute to document and analyze the experience of the Holland
Pavilion, compiling a useful manual with other best practices around the world.

 He advised the government to take the lead in public construction and
procurement to initiate the development of circular construction in Taiwan.
Measures include adopting modularized building materials, certifying old
materials for legal reuse should be taken. Also, the government should also
promote using platforms that document building materials that are connected with
the world to showcase circularity, to encourage among the international
community, and to facilitate the trading of old materials.

 瓦赫寧恩大學，被《國家地理雜誌》稱為荷蘭「食物矽谷」的知識中心，是小國荷蘭躍升農業巨人的秘密；畜牧環境學系主任Ingeborg de
Wolf，將分享實現永續畜牧業的定義、挑戰，和實現方法。Lely公司是自動農牧的領航者，感應器與資料分析研究員宋翔宇，會分享精準畜牧業中的智慧感應器和大數據分析；而我們的農業處長葛菈樂，則會談論荷蘭政府邁向循環農業的願景。

U.S., 270 times bigger in land size. The Netherlands is also the biggest floral
exporter in the world. However, faced with global heating and the depletion of
soil, water, and raw materials, the Netherlands is also moving towards more
sustainable agriculture. You wish to learn more? Don’t miss the international
forum “Innovative Cross-Sectoral Linkage for Circular Agriculture” next Thursday
(Oct. 31) and Friday (Nov. 1).

 The Wageningen University & Research, dubbed as the brain of the Food Valley in
the Netherlands by the National Geographic Magazine, is the secret behind the
Netherlands as a giant of agriculture. The Head of Department Livestock &
Environment, Ingeborg de Wolf, is going to share how to define sustainable
livestock farming, its challenges and possible solutions. The company Lely is
the leader in smart agriculture. Researcher Xiangyu Song is going to share his
experience with smart sensors and big data analysis in precision livestock
farming. The head of our department of agriculture and food, Gelare Nader, is

今天，我們慶祝「臺荷科學交流會」正式成立！我們集結了超過30位從事臺灣、荷蘭相關研究的學者，舉辦第一屆「臺灣研究日」。

 
荷蘭科學研究組織的社科與人文主任杜爾親自來臺主持，希望世界級的科學研究，會帶來科學和社會的影響。同時，他也介紹荷蘭有經費支持的國家研究計畫和公私結盟計畫，並指出新的政策要結合不同領域，以面對未來推陳出新的挑戰。曾多次在荷蘭講學的李鴻源教授也出席分享，表示許多與治水相關的計畫，在荷蘭發想、在臺灣實踐，希望透過跨領域的對話與團隊合作，得到更全面的解決方案。

 近年來，臺荷交流越來越豐富，科學也是其中之一。在光子學的領域上，我們促成荷蘭經濟部與臺灣經濟部技術處共同贊助歐盟
EUREKA「全球繁星」在臺灣的計畫，協助荷蘭 6 個頂尖的光學企業和研究中心與臺灣的 7 個夥伴合作，計畫總金額達到臺幣 2.34
億元；今年8月，我們也和臺北駐海牙辦事處簽署科技合作備忘錄，推動年度高層定期互訪，促成了「臺荷科學交流會」。

 想要更認識臺荷科學交流會，請聯絡：hollandinnovation@ntio.org.tw

 Today, we celebrated the foundation of the Holland Science Network in Taiwan!
We brought together more than 30 scientists who focus their discussions on
science collaborations between the Netherlands and Taiwan to the first “The
Netherlands & Taiwan Research Day” in Taipei.

 Wim van den Doel, Executive Boardmember and Chair of Social Sciences and
Humanities of the Dutch Research Council (NWO - Nederlandse Organisatie voor
Wetenschappelijk Onderzoek), also joined the celebration today. As NWO focuses
on world-class scientific research with scientific and societal impact, Prof.
van den Doel introduced already existing as well as two new programs, the
National Research Program and Public-Private Partnerships. Both are receiving
funding from NWO. He also explained that the new policy is focusing more on big
societal challenges that could be dealt with by interdisciplinary research
teams.

 Prof. Lee Hong-yuan, who has taught in the Netherlands many times, also shared
various projects of water management initiated in the Netherlands but
implemented in Taiwan. He learned that interdisciplinary dialogues and teamwork
will breed holistic approaches for new challenges.

 The exchanges in science between the Netherlands and Taiwan have been vibrant
in recent years. In photonics, we have realized the GlobalStars initiative of
EUREKA in Taiwan with the funding from the Ministries of Economic Affairs of the
Netherlands and Taiwan, helping 6 top research institutes and businesses in
photonics in the Netherlands to work with 7 Taiwanese partners, the budget
totaling € 6.7 million. This August, we have also signed an MoU of S&T
Cooperation to promote regular high-level visits and exchanges and S&T programs.
One of the activities performed by the Innovation Department at NTIO is
initiating the Holland Science Network in Taiwan. We are looking forward to a
vibrant and knowledge intensive network!

 More information about the Holland Science Network in Taiwan:
hollandinnovation@ntio.org.tw
